中文简介: 多元分析指多维度数据的统计分析方法。我们常见的数据都是多维度的。几年开始的大数据具有更高的数据维度。多元分析是统计学的基本方法。随着多元数据在更多的科学和社会科学领域的广泛采集，在北大开设一门比较高定位的多元分析课程也就迫在眉睫。本课程将涵盖针对分析多维（多元）统计数据（也包括超高维统计数据）的统计学模型和分析算法。多元统计方法可以直接运用到大数据统计分析的实践中。

中文简介: 本课程为全英文教学，旨在从东西方比较的视角出发，介绍18世纪以来（主要截至改革开放前）中国社会在人口、家庭、社会流动和财富分配等方面的基本特征与转变。课程内容重点整合近年来基于各类行政档案大规模微观数据库的量化历史国际比较研究，着眼于对比传统认识与实证新发现，讨论东西方社会的相同与不同，以期帮助学生客观、全面、系统理解中国社会，培养批判性、分析性、有据可依（evidence-based）的思辨习惯。同时，本课程响应学校教学创新的理念，采取“翻转课堂（flipped classroom）”教学模式。要求学生课前学习教学视频和阅读材料，分小组准备每周口头和书面报告，进而充分利用课堂时间进行师生互动深度研讨和启发式教学，培养学生在有效沟通、团队协作、口述报告、专业写作等方面的软实力。本课程相关教学视频基于开课教师与香港科学大学讲席教授James Lee（李中清）自2015年起合作教授的Coursera MOOC，制作精良、国际反响良好。“翻转课堂”具体教学计划同样由开课教师与李中清教授合作设计，并已作为香港科技大学社会科学硕士常规课程完成多次实践和改进，教学评价非常积极。
英文简介: This course summarizes some of the new directions in Chinese history and social science produced by the creation and analysis of big historical datasets based on newly opened Chinese archival holdings, and organizes this knowledge in a framework that encourages learning about China in comparative perspective.This course demonstrates how a new scholarship of discovery, generated by Big Historical Datasets, is redefining what is singular about modern China and modern Chinese history. Current understandings of human history and social theory are based largely on Western experience or on non-Western experience seen through a Western lens. This course offers alternative perspectives derived from Chinese experience over the last three centuries. We present specific case studies of this new scholarship of discovery, using a data analytic approach, divided into three stand-alone parts. Part One focuses on the question ‘Who are we?’ as seen through the framework of comparative population behavior - mortality, marriage, and reproduction – and their interaction with economic conditions and human values. We do so because mortality and reproduction are fundamental and universal, because they are measurable and often similarly defined and therefore easily comparable, because they differ historically just as radically between China and the West as patterns of inequality and opportunity, and because these differences demonstrate the mutability of human behavior and values.Parts Two and Three focus on comparative inequality and opportunity and addresses two related questions ‘Who rises to the top?’ and ‘Who gets what?’.  We begin with analyses of inequality in education and social mobility, then turn to the accumulation and distribution of wealth, and conclude with an analysis of political winners and losers under rural collectivization.Also, this course takes advantage of an innovative and well-developed ‘flipped classroom’ teaching design, which aims at helping student to improve their soft skills in team-working, professional communication, and academic writing.

Current understandings of human history and social theory are based largely on Western experience or on non-Western experience seen through a Western lens. This course offers alternative perspectives derived from Chinese experience over the last three centuries.Objectives:1.After finishing this course, students are expected to have a better evidence-based understanding, from a comparative perspective, about Chinese population and society since the 18th century.2.In addition, thanks to the ‘flipped classroom’ design, students are also expected to develop their soft skills, such as team-working, professional presentation, and academic writing.NO.DATETHEMEL1 Conceptual and Methodological IntroductionL2Who Are We; Who SurvivesL3Who ReproducesL4Who MarriesL5Who Cares L6Education and Social Mobility in the Qing L7Education and Social Mobility in the Republican China L8Education and Social Mobility in the People’s Republic of China L9Comparative Inequality and Opportunity Past and Present L10Wealth Accumulation and Distribution in the Past L11Wealth Accumulation and Distribution at the Time of Land Reform and Rural ReconstructionL12Wealth Accumulation and Distribution in the Present Group AssignmentsAll class assignments are by groups. There are no individual assignments. Depending on the enrollment, we divide the class into groups of four/five students each. Students must participate in five group PPT assignments and five group writing assignments.Generally, each week different groups are required to present and their counterparts to write persuasive essays based on pre-set topics and questions, followed by mutual formal discussion of each other’s presentation or writing. Students should submit a draft outline for presentation/writing and the complete assignments prior to the class. We strongly recommend students read the submitted outlines and assignments of their counterparts on Canvas prior to the class for better preparation.For presenting groups, each member must give at least one PPT presentation during the term. Presenters are expected to make their presentation in 15 minutes. After the presentation, the counterpart writing team should give constructive feedback on the presentation focusing on such specific aspects as Textual and Graphic Narrative, Oral Delivery, Evidence and Persuasiveness. For writing groups, students must submit one 1000-word coherent and cohesive group written exercise in response to the same set of questions assigned weekly to the presentation counterparts. Each writing exercise should have a different lead writer to be specified in the submissions, but all team members have to contribute. Each member must be a lead writer at least once during the semester. In addition to the writing assignments, writing groups in class are expected to make a one-slide presentation in 5 minutes outlining the main arguments and comparing similarities/differences with their counterpart presentation groups, while the counterpart presentation group should provide constructive feedbacks focusing on English Language, Organization, Evidence, and Persuasiveness based on the written text. There is no final assessment for this course. Students will be graded on the basis of all group assignments, as well as group engagement and class performance. Economics Series Working Papers.The ‘Flipped Classroom’ and Intended Learning Outcomes This course takes advantage of a flipped classroom course approach to train students to work together in groups rather than individually, and to improve their oral and written communication skills as well as their thinking.  By so doing, we emphasize working styles – cooperation, creativity, and leadership - as well as working skills. The design of this class, as well as the lecture videos, are jointly produced by Dr. Hao Dong and Prof. James Z. Lee in 2015. The flipped classroom teaching format and practices have ever since been improved through several rounds of teaching experiments as a regular Master of Arts in Global China Studies course taught at The Hong Kong University of Science and Technology.Specifically, students are required to watch class lectures outside the classroom before class meetings and to use in-class time instead for active learning through group and individual class discussions and group oral presentation and written assignments focusing on the same set of questions assigned weekly.  We hope, in other words, to build on connectivity to the thousands of earlier on-line students to foster greater engagement with the class materials and to form a common learning community. Our class focuses on developing three sets of soft skills which are necessary for virtually all professional achievement: ？Oral argumentation – timed presentation, peer commenting, and responses ？Written narratives – from descriptive, to analytic, to persuasive prose ？Group Teamwork – coordination, cooperation, leadershipWe also, so far as we can in such a short course, provide some exposure to current academic research and research methods, and research philosophy.1.PPT presentations—35 percent of course grade. The group presentations and discussion based on the corresponding weekly topics will be graded in terms of Textual and Graphic narrative, Oral delivery, Evidence and Persuasiveness.  2.Writing exercises—35 percent of course grade. Students will submit 1000-word group writing exercises on assigned topics, which will be graded in terms of English language, Organization, Evidence and Persuasiveness. 3.Discussion—15 percent of course grade. 10 percent will be graded on student discussion about assigned PPT presentations and writing exercises. 5 percent will be graded on class participation.  4.Group teamwork—15 percent of course grade. Students peer assessment on teamwork by group members will be included in the final grading at the end of the term.

中文简介: 本课程将从经济发展与制度变迁两个维度讲述和分析中国经济的历史与现实，主要侧重在计划经济时期和改革开放时期中国经济的运行机制、发展绩效和内在逻辑。本课程的特色之处在于基于经济学理论与前沿研究文献解析和讲述“中国故事”，从市场与政府的互动视角理解中国经济的运行逻辑和演变进程，从国际比较的视角界定和分析中国经济的发展绩效及其治理的特征。

教学大纲: 配合大班讨论。双周上课，一次2小时。每次课先回顾大课授课内容，然后组织专题讨论。本课程属于配合《组织与管理》必修课的小班授课，通过答疑解惑、经典阅读、案例研究和互动讨论，使学生了解组织管理学的基本理论视角及方法。小班授课的定位为：加深理解，开拓视野，定位兴趣，提高能力。课堂共有七次，每次两小时，分为两个部分。在每次课程的第一部分，教员将解答同学们与《组织与管理》所讲授内容有关的问题，组织学生们讨论辅导班布置的经典文献及大课中的核心内容。在每次课程的第二部分，我们将采用案例教学，即同学与教员结合案例素材、就相关议题加以研讨，通过案例分析帮助同学们进一步理解《组织与管理》所讲授概念、理论、框架在现实中的应用。     在课程的课下部分，推荐了10余本经典的管理学书目，供同学任选其一进行深度阅读与反思，课程结束后上交阅读报告，以训练课程参与者的思考与研究能力。以讨论与案例研究为主平时成绩+小组研究成绩+报告。小班成绩占本课程总成绩的40%，其中：（1）课堂讨论与参与（10%）：本课程要求每位同学在课前都要对相关的案例和阅读材料进行预习，并作好回答问题的准备。同学在课堂上要带名牌。任课老师和助教将根据各位同学的课堂表现进行评估，计10分。评估结果分为四档：优（10-9分）、良（8-7分）、中（6分）、差（0-5分）。（2）小组案例分析与实例研究（20%）：全体同学分为4个学习小组，每组5-6人。每个小组在学期中负责一次案例分析引导，课堂上准备20分钟左右的演讲，约12-18页的PPT，上课6小时前发给任课老师和助教，成绩占10%；每个小组在课程中关注一家企业或现实问题进行实例研究，研究汇报安排在最后一次课上，要求每个小组进行25分钟的研究汇报（含5-10分钟问答，约15-20张PPT），成绩占10%。小组汇报及报告的评估，按选题创意（30%）、分析与诊断（25%）、结论与启示（25%）、表达与呈现（20%）来进行评价。（3）经典书目阅读报告（10%）：小班中的每位同学，选取参考书目中编号3-13中的任一本，在学期中进行阅读，期末上交个人阅读报告，内容包括：书的体系和框架、核心观点、实践运用、个人感受最深的地方、可以进一步探索的问题等（包括但不限于此）。要求观点明确，内容详实，充分体现个人特质与思考深度，字数在3000-8000字之间。

中文简介: 本课的主要目的是向学生介绍经济学的基本原理。课程的上半部主要关注微观经济学问题，即经济体中的基本个体（家庭与企业）进行决策与选择的问题。课程的下半部重点讨论宏观经济学问题，即社会作为一个整体所面临的基本问题（如失业，通货膨胀，货币政策，国际贸易等）。
英文简介: The main purpose of this lesson is to introduce the basic principles of economics. The course focuses on microeconomics, the problem of decision-making and choice between the basic individual (family and enterprise) in the economy. Besides,  the course focuses on macroeconomics, the basic problems that society faces as a whole (unemployment, inflation, monetary policy, international trade, etc.).

教材: 从古典经济学派到马克思：若干主要学说发展论略,陈岱孙,商务印书馆,201404,1,9787100099288；西方经济学,吴易风、颜鹏飞,高等教育出版社、人民出版社,201100,1,978-7-04-033312-1；Economics,Paul A. Samuelson and William D. Nordhaus,McGraw-Hill Companies,200904,19,978-0073511290；无,
教学大纲: 目的是使学生掌握经济学的基本概念和原理，提高对于经济问题与经济事件的理解与分析能力， 为自身专业的进一步学习打下基础。Chapter 1 IntroductionChapter 2 The Modern Mixed EconomyChapter 3 Basic Elements of Supply and DemandChapter 4 Supply and Demand: Elasticity and ApplicationsChapter 5 Demand and Consumer BehaviorChapter 6 Production and Business OrganizationHoliday. 中文简介: 行为经济学是目前经济学中的前沿和热点研究领域。行为经济学从探究理性人假设是否完全符合现实出发，把心理学和经济分析方法相结合，研究人的心理因素如何影响经济行为，进而给出独特的政策建议。这对于我们理解金融危机和现实经济行为具有重要的意义。本课程系统地介绍行为经济学的主要内容和方法论，讨论其产生发展的过程，以及它和新古典经济学的相互促进的关系。本课程将根据大量的实验室实验，田野实验和实证证据来讲述实际决策中人们如何系统性地偏离理性人假设。主要的议题包括：社会性偏好，参照点偏好，时间偏好不一致和自我控制问题，对概率判断的偏差，过度自信，有限的博弈思考能力等等。在这些证据的基础上，我们将讨论如何修正现有的经济学模型使之更加精确描述人们的决策心理和行为。我们将同时关注这些行为模型在各个经济领域，如劳动供给，储蓄消费，风险决策和金融中的应用，也在一定程度上介绍行为金融学发展的成果。最后，我们将讨论行为经济学的政策建议。这种建议通常具有低成本，高成效和隐性的特点，甚至很多时候带有母性的人文关怀。
英文简介: Behavioral economics is one of the most popular and frontier research fields in economics. This field investigates whether the classical rationality assumption in economics is an accurate reflection of people’s decision making process. By combining psychology and analytical tool of economics, behavioral economics explores how psychological factors affect economic decision making and further proposes policy advice. This perspective is important for us to understand the recent financial crisis and decision making in reality.This course systematically introduces the contents and methodology of behavior economics, its historical root and development history, and in particular its relationship with neoclassical economics. This course will discuss many laboratory experiments, field experiments and natural field data to shed light on how human behavior systematically deviates from rationality assumption in certain cases. The main topics include: social preferences, reference-deponent preferences, time inconsistency and self control problem, probabilistic judgment, overconfidence and limited strategic reasoning. Based on these evidence, we further analyze how to develop behavioral model based on neoclassical model to obtain a more accurate description of these behavioral traits. We then apply these models in various economic fields, including labor supply decision, consumption saving decision, choice under uncertainty and finance. Lastly, we will discuss policy advice from behavioral economics, which often features low cost, satisfactory performance and paternalism.

Pareto Efficiency; Efficiency versus Equity）     案例1： Coase Theorem 碳交易     案例2： 劳动合同法， 最低工资， 华为买断工龄第三讲价格歧视第四讲1）全球化对劳动力市场的影响。重点是让学生讨论为什么会出现“China Syndrome”的现象。2）中国劳动力市场现状分析。重点是让学生了解中国的劳动力市场现状。第五讲1）中国的收入分配差距问题2）中等收入陷阱问题3）中国GDP核算与GDP造假问题第六讲（1）总需求    (a)  个人的消费，投资决策    (b)  个人消费/投资和总体消费/投资    (c)  节俭悖论    (d)  短期总需求和长期总需求（2） 货币    (a)  货币的起源和功能    (b)  货币到底是否是中性的    (c)  历史上的货币政策得失分析    (d)  现代货币和货币政策第七讲（1）世界范围内长期增长的基本事实（2）工业革命前的增长、工业革命后的增长、现代社会增长的区别（3）中国可持续增长前景（4）中国汇率是否被低估（5）国际金融一体化的趋势以及中国在其中扮演的角色第八讲中国金融问题中国经济危机教学模式分为“大课教学”与“小班研讨”两个模块。大课教学：全体同学统一时间、地点上课。由任课老师统一讲解各章节的重点内容，为达到良好的学习效果，课前希望学生能够做好该章节的预习工作。小班教学：全体同学分为十个班，每班20人左右。各班分地点、时间上课。由相应的辅导老师根据当周大课讲解的内容进行辅导。具体形式包括概念复习、案例讲解、例题分析、实践参与等，是对课程内容的重要深化与补充。要求同学全程参与。考勤占 10% （包括大课与小班）平时作业占20%期中闭卷考试占25%期末闭卷考试占45%

Pareto Efficiency; Efficiency versus Equity）     案例1： Coase Theorem 碳交易     案例2： 劳动合同法， 最低工资， 华为买断工龄第三讲价格歧视第四讲1）全球化对劳动力市场的影响。重点是让学生讨论为什么会出现“China Syndrome”的现象。2）中国劳动力市场现状分析。重点是让学生了解中国的劳动力市场现状。第五讲1）中国的收入分配差距问题2）中等收入陷阱问题3）中国GDP核算与GDP造假问题第六讲（1）总需求    (a)  个人的消费，投资决策    (b)  个人消费/投资和总体消费/投资    (c)  节俭悖论    (d)  短期总需求和长期总需求（2） 货币    (a)  货币的起源和功能    (b)  货币到底是否是中性的    (c)  历史上的货币政策得失分析    (d)  现代货币和货币政策第七讲（1）世界范围内长期增长的基本事实（2）工业革命前的增长、工业革命后的增长、现代社会增长的区别（3）中国可持续增长前景（4）中国汇率是否被低估（5）国际金融一体化的趋势以及中国在其中扮演的角色第八讲中国金融问题中国经济危机教学模式分为“大课教学”与“小班研讨”两个模块。大课教学：全体同学统一时间、地点上课。由任课老师统一讲解各章节的重点内容，为达到良好的学习效果，课前希望学生能够做好该章节的预习工作。小班教学：全体同学分为十个班，每班20人左右。各班分地点、时间上课。由相应的辅导老师根据当周大课讲解的内容进行辅导。具体形式包括概念复习、案例讲解、例题分析、实践参与等，是对课程内容的重要深化与补充。要求同学全程参与。考勤占 10% （包括大课与小班）平时作业占20%期中闭卷考试占25%期末闭卷考试占45%

中文简介: 本课程旨在培养学生评估和管理风险的能力。金融风险将是本课程的重点。企业全面风险管理将是贯穿本课程的主题。本课程结束时，学生们会对怎样评估和管理金融机构的整体风险有直观的理解。本课程首先介绍风险管理有助于提高企业价值的原因，然后提出利用风险管理提高企业价值的总体框架。 基于这个框架，本课程将介绍怎样评估和管理市场风险,，现金流风险，利率风险，信用风险，以及经营风险。在学生熟悉了各种风险之后，本课程将转而讨论怎样评估和管理总的企业整体风险。怎样用企业整体风险管理的方法来评估绩效和做公司决策是此过程的主题。最后，本课程会讨论与风险管理有关的时事。
英文简介: This course is designed to train the participants in evaluating and managing risks using an enterprise-wide approach. Most of the course deals with financial risks. The course starts with an analysis of how risk management contributes to firm value. A general framework for how to use risk management to create value is presented next. The course then examines the measurement and management of market risks, cash flow risks for non-financial firms, interest rate risks, credit risks, and operational risks. The course turns next to the implementation issues of enterprise-wide risk management, showing how to aggregate risks across the firm and how to use a firm-wide risk measure to make various corporate decisions and to evaluate performance within the firm. The course finishes with a discussion of recent issues in risk management.  Students have to be comfortable with Excel, Black-Scholes, and the CAPM to attend successfully; if you are not comfortable with these tools, you should not take the course. Risk management problems for financial intermediaries as well as for firms outside the financial sector are also examined. Students will learn how to manage financial risks through lectures, exercises, and cases. A major component of the course is a four-part case that covers all aspects of integrated risk management. At the completion of that case, students will have measured firm-wide risk for a financial institution.

Having background knowledge in statistics or econometrics is highly beneficial for understanding the course materials.This course provides an overview of risk management in financial institutions and its importance in today’s global market place. It examines (1) the various risks faced by major institutions such as banks, insurance companies, and institutional investors, (2) the quantification of these risks, (3) the management of these risks, (4) and the evolution of the regulatory environment around these institutions. 中文简介: 1中国财政部颁发的《金融企业会计制度》遵循了国际会计准则协会关于“实质重于形式”和“充分审慎性”的会计原则，对金融企业的资产和负债重新进行了定义，同时给予企业会计人员较多的职业判断权，更加注重会计核算的全面谨慎性和会计信息的高质量性，对防范金融风险，提高金融企业会计披露的透明度，起到了推动作用。我国当前金融企业会计的大部分规定和内容是同国际惯例相吻合的，它的颁布和实施，也标志着我国银行业会计标准在会计要素定义、确认和计量、财务报告体系等重大方面基本实现了与国际会计惯例的一致和协调，并对实现金融企业会计标准的国际化、提高我国银行业的会计信息在国际资本市场上的认可程度迈出了一大步，为我国银行业与国外银行的横向对比奠定了坚实的会计基础。因此，这门课程的开设对于培养新经济环境下的会计人才，对于增强中国金融业转型升级期间的人力资源储备，具有重大的意义。本课程针对各类金融企业的会计业务进行讲授。首先介绍金融企业会计的对象、 特征、作用、任务，然后分别讲述金融企业会计的基本核算方法。重点介绍金融企业会计科目、记帐方法、会计凭证、帐簿、报表和财务分析，以及金融企业帐务组织等，主要突出金融企业会计特点。首先讲授银行会计，其次是非银行金融企业，如证券业务、信托投资业务、租赁业务核算、信贷风险的财务分析、保险会计和房地产会计。

开课院系: 光华管理学院(Guanghua School of Management)
教学大纲: 让学生更多地了解金融企业会计相关理论与实践第一章 总 论金融企业是一个特殊的服务性行业，本章要求学生掌握的是如何把会计学的基本原理和基本方法运用到金融企业这一特殊行业中去。第二章 基本核算方法 金融企业会计核算方法是根据会计方法的一般原理，结合金融企业的业务特点和经营管理要求，采取一种具有行业特点的会计核算方法。本章介绍的是银行业核算，主要内容是设置会计科目、确定记帐方法、审核填制凭证、登记帐簿、清查财产、计算成本、编制报表及相应的帐务组织和帐务处理程序。第三章 存贷款业务的核算 通过这一章的学习，使学生掌握商业银行的存贷款业务核算 这是商业银行的基本业务核算。存贷款种类、风险贷款管理及存贷款业务的具体会计核算方法。第四章 支付结算业务的核算 本章要求学生从银行核算的角度，掌握各种不同结算方式的核算，以区别与一般非银行金融企业的财务会计的支付结算业务核算。掌握银行支付结算的基本程序、各种规章制度、具体会计核算方法。第五章 联行往来的核算联行业务核算是银行会计的核心内容，银行办理的支付业务、代理国家金库业务、货币发行、外汇往来、资金调拨等均要通过联行往来实现，所以联行业务是商业银行系统内机构之间资金帐务往来的重要渠道。本章要求学生掌握联行往来的基本要求、基本做法和各级联行的具体核算方法。教学内容第一节 联行往来概述一、联行往来的意义和特点。二、目前我国联行的组织体系。三、联行往来的基本要求与联行业务的基本做法。第二节 全国联行往来的核算一、全国联行往来的会计凭证、会计科目。二、全国联行往来的日常核算。第三节 资金汇划清算的核算一、资金汇划清算体系的基本做法。二、资金汇划往来与清算的核算。三、系统内资金调拨业务的核算。第六章 金融机构往来的核算本章主要讲述金融机构之间的资金帐务往来。既包括不同金融企业跨系统之间的资金帐务往来，又包括商业银行与中央银行之间的资金帐务往来，反映了我国多元化金融机构体制下经济往来的多样性、复杂性和广泛性。教学内容第七章 外汇业务核算本章讲授要求学生应该掌握外汇买卖核算、国际贸易结算业务核算、外汇存款业务与外汇贷款业务的核算方法、人民币经常项目下可兑换方法、境内机构资本项目下如何办理收付汇以及待结汇业务。第八章 证券业务的核算教学要求本章要求学生掌握证券业务的种类和它的会计核算特点。具体的证券业务核算要掌握证券经纪业务、代理买卖、证券自营业务、证券承销业务、全额包销、余额包销、代销和其它证券业务、买入返售、卖出回购的会计核算。第九章 信托投资业务的核算 在这一章里学生应该掌握信托投资业务的概念和意义、信托投资业务的分类 重点掌握信托投资业务的会计核算。第十章 租赁业务核算通过这一章的学习，使学生了解租赁的一般概念、租赁的意义、种类以及租赁的会计核算。重点是融资租赁业务的会计核算。本课程以课堂教学为主要方式，所有内容均采用多媒体课件展示。辅助环节包括课堂提问、自由发言、案例报告讨论与分析，并会安排同学到真实企业实地考察实践。作业+案例报告 20%期末考试 80%

中文简介: 随着全球化经济的形成，以及信息技术和电子商务的迅速发展，企业的生存和竞争环境也随之改变。以往，企业面对的是和同类对手之间的竞争。而在全球市场和数字经济时代，企业要依靠和上游以及下游企业的联盟与协作，才能在市场竞争中取得优势。这意味着现在的竞争变成了供应链和供应链之间的竞争。在这种背景下，供应链管理的理念在近二十年来引起了企业界和学术界的极大关注，并在理论和实践中得到了进一步发展。在今天的企业中也出现了供应链经理、供应链主管或是供应链VP这样的重要职位。因而对商学院的学生，无论是在企业界或是学术界发展，供应链管理都是一门重要的课程。
英文简介: With the formation of the global economy and the rapid development of information technology and e-commerce, the survival and competitive environment of enterprises have also changed. In the past, companies faced competition from rivals. In the global market and digital economy, enterprises can gain advantages in market competition by relying on alliances and cooperation with upstream and downstream enterprises. This means that today's competition is becoming a competition between supply chains and supply chains. In this context, the concept of supply chain management has attracted great attention from the business community and academia in the past two decades, and has been further developed in theory and practice. In today's enterprise, there are also important positions such as supply chain manager, supply chain manager or supply chain VP. As a result, supply chain management is an important course for business school students, both in business and academia.

中文简介: 本课程主要包括金融市场与金融机构两部分内容。金融市场部分将讨论一级市场与二级市场的组织与微观结构，以及股票市场、货币市场、国债市场、公司债券市场、市政证券市场等各个金融工具的子市场。金融机构部分将讨论商业银行等存款性金融机构，投资基金、投资银行、金融公司等非存款性金融机构。本课程的特色是既把握现代西方金融机构与金融市场理论与实践的最新发展，又紧密结合中国实际，描述与分析中国相应领域的历史变迁与现时问题。既有基本理论与市场运行的框架性介绍，又有切中国内外金融市场与机构热点问题的深入探讨。
英文简介: none
开课院系: 光华管理学院(Guanghua School of Management)
教材: 金融市场与金融机构,曹凤岐，贾春新,北京大学出版社,201400,2,978-7-301-24678-8/F 4023；金融市场与金融机构,弗雷德里克·S.米什金，斯坦利·G.埃金斯,原书，杜惠芬译,中国人民大学出版社,201700,8,9787300247311；《金融市场与金融机构》,3.桑德斯（Saunders，A.）,科尼特（Cornett，M.M.）,人民邮电出版社,2008,《金融市场与金融机构》,曹凤岐，贾春新,北京大学出版社,2002,Financial markets and institutions,Madura, Jeff,北京大学出版社影印本,2008,
教学大纲: 在课程结束时，学生应该能够：1.运用基本金融经济学理论解释金融市场与金融机构是如何运行的。2.说明中国金融市场与金融机构发展的现状、历程及其原因。3.说明不同的金融机构－如银行、保险、金融公司、投资基金、投资银行等－的业务与管理特点，分析它们之间的差异及其形成原因4.用经济学与金融学理论分析如何对商业银行进行监管。5.理解理论界关注的热点金融市场与金融机构现象：如IPO抑价、投资基金的表现、中央银行票据发行等。6.解释金融市场的组织与微观结构，如股票发行过程，交易市场的结构，做市商制度与竞价制度等7.分析比较不同的货币市场工具的特点。8.理解国债的发行与交易市场制度。9.解释公司债券市场的组成与特点。日期内容9月9日第一章：导论9月16日第二章：存款性金融机构（上）9月23日第二章：存款性金融机构（中）9月30日第三章：存款性金融机构（下）10月7日国庆放假10月14日第三章：非存款性机构（上）10月21日第三章：非存款性机构（中）10月28日第三章：非存款性机构（下）11月4日第四章：市场组织与结构（上）11月11日第四章：市场组织与结构（中）11月18日第四章：市场组织与结构（下）11月25日第五章：股权市场（上）12月2日第五章：股权市场（下）12月9日第六章：货币市场12月16日第七章：财政证券市场12月23日第八章：公司债券市场Final Exam2011年12月30日上午 8:30-10：30课堂讲授为主。个别章节将邀请金融业界成功人士参与讨论。作业与课堂参与:40%期末闭卷考试：60％

Financing: introduce the important financial decisions of the company, such as capital budgeting decision, capital structure decision, dividend decision, etc.

中文简介: 本课程从品牌的基本概念入手，从理论和实务相结合的角度详细、深入地阐述企业创建和管理品牌，以及不断提升品牌资产的基本流程。具体包括：品牌名称和标识的设计和选择、品牌定位的确定、品牌形象的塑造和维护，以及品牌资产的维护与提升等。
英文简介: Starting from the basic concept of brand, this course elaborates on the creation and management of brands from the perspective of theory and practice, as well as the basic process of continuously enhancing brand equity. Specific include: brand name and logo design and selection, brand positioning determination, brand image building and maintenance, and brand asset maintenance and promotion.
开课院系: 光华管理学院(Guanghua School of Management)
教材: 无；《战略品牌管理》,凯文?科勒，李乃和译,中国人民大学出版社,
教学大纲: 通过课堂讲授（包括教师、学生，以及企业有关从业人员）和案例讨论，以及作业的完成，使学生了解品牌管理的相关理论和实务，达到提高学生综合运用品牌管理和相关学科的理论，以发现、分析和解决理论与实际问题能力的目的。第一讲  品牌概述1.品牌定义2.品牌要素3.品牌类型4.品牌失败的原因5.案例讨论：DM公司的隐忧6.思考题：品牌是什么？企业或其产品（服务）必须品牌化吗？第二讲  品牌名称的确定（3学时）1.品牌名称的自然属性2.品牌名称的延伸属性3.影响品牌名称的因素4.品牌名称的实例5.思考题：企业什么时候应当或需要更改品牌名称？第三讲  品牌设计和品牌定位1.品牌设计2.品牌创建3.品牌定位4.思考题： 品牌定位的关键因素及其对品牌塑造成功的影响？第四讲  品牌形象的塑造1.品牌形象的概述2.品牌个性的塑造3.品牌关系的建立与维护4.案例讨论：“皇明太阳能的品牌策略”5.思考题：品牌形象代言人的选择与品牌形象的关系第五讲  品牌延伸与联合1.品牌延伸2.品牌联合3.案例讨论：“佛达公司的品牌苦境”4.思考题：品牌延伸——向上或者向下第六讲  营销策略与品牌资产1.价格策略对品牌资产的影响2.广告策略对品牌资产的影响周章节内容Week 1　第一讲  品牌概述Week 2　第二讲  品牌名称的确定Week 3　第三讲  品牌设计和品牌定位（上）Week 4　第三讲  品牌设计和品牌定位（下）Week 5　第四讲  品牌形象的塑造（上）Week 6　第四讲  品牌形象的塑造（下）Week 7　第五讲  品牌延伸与联合Week 8品牌管理实例讲座Week 9　第六讲  营销策略与品牌资产Week 10　小组汇报Week 11　小组汇报Week 12　课程总结Final Exam教学方式包括：教员讲授、学生实践作业分享和案例分析，以及企业有关人员的讲座。最终成绩的比例为：案例讨论和课堂参与（30%）、小组作业（30%）和个人作业（30%），以及教师个人评价（10%）。

中文简介: 企业可持续发展问题首先是企业持续“谁的发展”的问题。企业首先要持续企业的发展。而自然环境和相关社会领域中不断升级的可持续性问题和挑战，要求传统工商企业采取前瞻性和创新性的策略和行动，争取持续的竞争优势；同时，也为创业者提供了前所未有的创业使命和机会。因此，本课程旨在通过梳理现有文献、分析案例和参与企业实践，学习“可持续发展导向的工商业创新与创业”。课程涉及的主要内容包括：?如何利用改善生态环境和保护人类健康的新技术及新商业模式进行创业或公司创业，比如新能源与废弃物资源化等；?如何推动传统产业改造中可持续性导向的创新和创业，比如绿色制造、环保材料、有机农业、能效管理，以及循环经济商业案例等；?如何促进可持续发展的战略联盟和运营模式的创业，比如工业生态、供应链绿化、环保专业运营/咨询服务，以及公共事业市场化等。
英文简介: The problem of sustainable development of enterprises is the problem of "whose development". First, enterprises should continue the development of enterprises. And in the field of natural environment and related social sustainability of the escalating problems and challenges, for the traditional business forward-looking and innovative strategies and action, strive for sustainable competitive advantage; At the same time, it also provides entrepreneurs with unprecedented entrepreneurial mission and opportunities. Therefore, this course aims to study "sustainable development oriented industrial and commercial innovation and entrepreneurship" by combing existing literature, analyzing cases and participating in enterprise practice.

教学大纲: 本门课程希望达到的目标是：帮助学生掌握重要的专业技能，适应社会经济发展的需要，富有时代特征和创新精神，能够在财务管理领域胜任专业工作。学生能够系统掌握会计审计与财务管理的基本理论和方法，熟悉会计、金融、税收实务业务，了解本专业的理论前沿和发展动态，对工商企业、金融证券企业、市场中介机构、事业单位和政府部门当中从事财务、会计、金融管理、决策咨询等实际工作具有较深入的了解。周章节内容任课教师Week 1　财务人员在企业里的地位和角色朱宏标Week 2　关于中国商业银行发展的几个议题梁亮Week 3　事务所和会计实践张毅强Week 4　企业资金信用管理简介 梁立山Week 5　北京市海淀区 “十二五”规划纲要解读刘建明Week 6　房地产企业现金流管理薛莲Week 7　实证会计研究与会计研究方法张然Week 8  案例讨论王咏梅Week 9　会计信息与股票内在价值估计（1）陈磊Week 10会计信息与股票内在价值估计（2）陈磊Week 11　商业模式与基本面分析（1）陈磊Week 12　商业模式与基本面分析（2）陈磊Week 13员工股票期权会计计量陈磊Week 14IT企业收入核算与估值陈磊Week 15  经济增加值-理论与应用（1）陈磊Week 16  经济增加值-理论与应用（2）陈磊Final Exam　课堂讲授为主，案例讨论为辅。课堂期末考试。考察的具体范围和方式开课后确定。

中文简介: 过去30年中国经济的显著增长改变了全球商业格局。中国市场及其非凡的增长不仅对中国很重要，对世界其他地区也越来越重要。在这门课程中，我们将仔细研究中国的商业前景，以及跨国企业和国内企业面临的机遇和挑战。我们将在全球化的背景下，更好地理解中国的根本因素和制度变迁。本课程将从企业决策者的角度出发，也会涉及一些重要的功能层面的问题。
英文简介: The remarkable economic growth of China in the last 3 decades changes the landscape of global business. China market and its phenomenal growth are not only important to China, but also increasingly important to the rest of the world. In this course, we are going to take a close look at what has happened to China’s business landscape, the opportunities and challenges for both multinational enterprises and domestic firms. We are going to gain a better understanding on the fundamental factors and institutional changes in China in the context of globalization. This course will take the perspective from the corporate decision makers, although a few important functional level issues will also be covered.
开课院系: 光华管理学院(Guanghua School of Management)
教学大纲: The objectives of this course include the development of 1) a general management perspective on China business environments; 2) Knowledge about functional areas and operations in conducting China business; and 3) basic skills of analyzing international economic environments and exploring business opportunities.Learning Goal 1: Graduates will possess a solid understanding of business and management and will be able to translate this knowledge into practice.1.1Objective 1 Our students will have a good command of fundamental theories and knowledge.1.2Objective 2 Our students will have a good command of analytical methods and decision-making tools. 1.3Objective 3 Our students will be able to apply theories and methodologies in key business functions. Learning Goal 2: Our students will be able to think critically.2.1Objective 1 Our students will be able to identify and summarize problems2.2Objective 2 Our students will be able to collect data and analyze problems in a critical manner 2.3Objective 3 Our students will be able to put forward effective solutions to business problems Learning Goal 3: Our students will have a sense of social responsibility.3.1Objective 1 Our students will be aware of the importance of ethics.3.2Objective 2 Our students will be able to provide solutions that take account of contrasting ethical standpoints. Learning Goal 4: Our students will be effective communicators.4.1Objective 1 Our students will be proficient in oral and written communication.4.2Objective 2 Our students will possess good interpersonal skills.4.3Objective 3 Our students will be able to adapt to diverse learning environments.Learning Goal 5: Our students will have global perspectives.5.1Objective 1 Our students will be aware of social and cultural differences.5.2Objective 2 Our students will be aware of the impact of globalization on business operations, opportunities, and challenges. 5.3Objective 3 Our students will be proficient in English.This course combines lectures, class discussions and case studies in order to maximize the effectiveness of learning and benefits to the participants. Students are required to follow the unfolding economic and business events in China and use them as examples and cases for class discussion. Students are organized in groups to complete a study on a chosen topic on China business.The final grades consist of two components: (1) Class attendance and participation in class discussion. (2) Group Project Report. The project report will be presented and discussed in the class.

先修课程: 本课程先修课程为《财务会计》或《会计学》，学生已经掌握了会计学基础知识，本课程在此基础上教授学生分析财务报表。
中文简介: 本课程的主要内容是分析企业资产负债表，损益表，现金流量表，并在此基础上开展企业主要业务的财务信息分析，杜邦分析，盈利能力分析，帮助学生掌握分析企业财务状况与经营状况的方法和体系。
英文简介: This course helps student analyze a firm`s balance sheet, income statement, statement of cash flows, and based on these analyses, students then analyze financial information of major business operations and decision items, DuPont analysis, profitability analysis. Overall, this course helps student establish a framework of financial analysis and operation analysis thus provides foundation for future decision making.
开课院系: 光华管理学院(Guanghua School of Management)
教学大纲: 1. 使学生掌握企业财务报表分析的基本方法和框架2. 使学生从财务报表分析中发现经营问题3. 锻炼学生提出解决问题的财务方案本课程的内容从财务信息在经济与经营决策中发挥的作用出发，有的放矢地分析财务报表信息。涵盖资产负债表、损益表、现金流量表等三大表分析，及在此基础上的重要经营科目财务分析。学生对每个科目的分析深入后，可以把报表数据和企业经营有机地结合起来，相互印证，为经营决策提供依据。本课程的特点是财务分析要与企业经营投资等决策问题结合起来，不能以财务报表论财务报表，同学要把自己放到管理者、决策者的角度看财务报表，分析财务报表，发现经营问题，提出财务解决方案。1. Introduction （3学时）2. The Balance Sheet （3学时）3. The Income Statement  （3学时）4. The Statement of Cash Flows  （3学时）5. Receivables and Revenue Recognition  （3学时）6. DuPont Analysis  （3学时）7. 英文简介: This class includes two parts. Part A is intended to teach students the fundamentals of the value approach to investment management developed by Graham and Dodd. This will be done through a combination of formal lectures, cases and in-class valuation discussions. The substantive areas covered will include (1) the fundamental assumptions and approaches to value investing, (2) techniques for assessing fundamental value – balance sheet and earnings power approaches, (3) structuring value-based portfolios to control risk, (4) designing strategies for searching efficiently for value investing opportunities and (5) regulations, investor protection and corporate governance, and their impact of firm value . Part B of this class is intended to expose students to the practical implementation of Graham and Dodd investing principles. Through presentations by leading value investors, students will learn how individuals develop an investment process to suit their personality and personal biases. Investors will discuss: 1. search strategy, 2. valuation approach, 3. research techniques, and 4. risk management in the context of their own investments.

中文简介: 渠道管理是营销管理四个重要的战略之一，主要是向终端客户提供生产厂商无法提供的一些服务。但是，分销渠道不仅仅是企业服务终端客户的一种，其实本身也是企业的客户，分销渠道也有自己的需求。同时，渠道不仅销售企业的产品，同时也会销售竞争品牌的产品，而且有时候还会自己生产产品。所以，渠道成员集管道，客户，竞争者的角色为一体。了解他们的动机和战略是这门课的目标之一。
英文简介: The distribution channel is one of the four Ps of the marketing mix, providing many essential services to end-customers that the firm cannot efficiently provide itself. But, the distribution channel is not just a conduit through which the firm reaches its end market. The channel members are customers in their own right, with their own needs. Further, they market not only the firm’s products but also competitors’ products and, increasingly, their own private label products. Thus, channel members are conduit, customer, and competitor rolled into one, and their motivations and objectives are often not aligned with those of the firm.

英文简介: This course is intermediate microeconomics for undergraduate students. The course starts by analyzing the behavior of consumers and producers, and then extends the discussion to how individual decisions and market interacts, how market structures affect price and welfare, and under what circumstances market can fail in maximizing social welfare. This course also discusses other classical microeconomic topics such as game theory and information economics. We also cover the frontier research topics in microeconomics such as behavioral economics. In terms of the basic logic, this course starts from rationality assumption, and discusses how utility maximization, the basic method of economics, can be applied in analyzing individual decisions, and what are the limitation of the classical assumption. This course will use certain amount of algebra and calculus, but we will emphasize on the intuition and graphic illustrations.

中文简介: 本课程介绍有别于经典金融学的行为金融研究。课程首先简单回顾经典金融理论重要信条：期望效用函数，有效市场假说，价格-价值等价假说，无套利原则以及资产分散化，以及这些理论所蕴含的可检验含义。接着以实证证据说明这些假说在现实市场之不能成立。其次介绍行为金融的两大支柱：有限套利与个体心理偏差（信念，偏好）。然后介绍诸多市场异象，并以所学的理论对这些异象做出行为金融的解释。最后介绍行为金融的最新发展，特别是对最近金融危机的研究成果。行为金融学科的特点是理论与实证紧密结合，互相印证和发展，且思路广阔而不囿于单一学科，是典型的跨学科联合攻关的典范，这也将是本课程在讲授时会体现的风格，让学生在理论与实证之间不断切换，提升对金融市场和人性的深刻理解。
英文简介: This course focuses on behavioral finance, one of the most dynamic and fruitful fields in modern finance studies. We first offer a brief overview of classical finance theory, including efficient market hypothesis, “price equals value”, no arbitrage principle and diversifications, among many others. We then show several important empirical evidences that run encounter to the implications of those doctrines. We introduce the two building blocks of behavioral finance: limits of arbitrage and psychological biases (belief and preference). We present several interesting market anomalies which can hardly be explained by the rational theory and show how behavioral finance can offer coherent explanations. In the final stage, we also introduce some recent progress in behavioral finance, especially the studies on financial crisis.

教学大纲: 要求学生对现代金融研究的前沿之一——行为金融有总纲式的了解，理解行为金融产生的背景、要解决的主要问题、研究特色和方法以及目前取得的成就，引起学生对行为金融产生兴趣，深化对人性和金融市场本质的理解。Behavioral Finance1.Doctrines from Classical Finance Theory？Efficient Market Hypothesis: Friedman’s argument？Price equals value formula？Law of One Price—No Arbitrage Principle (Puzzles: closed-end funds, twin shares, index inclusion, equity carve-outs, Chinese A shares and B shares)？Diversification2.Building Block I: Limits of Arbitrage？Noise Trader Risk3.Building Block II: Psychological Biases？Benchmark: Rational Investors？Beliefs (overconfidence and illusion of confidence, optimism, availability bias and hindsight bias, the law of small numbers, anchoring, base rate neglect and representativeness, confirmation bias, familiarity bias etc) ？Preference (Prospect Theory, Ambiguity Aversion) 4.Applications？Cross-sectional Market Anomalies (Value versus growth, the small-firm effect, momentum and reversal, lagged reactions to earnings announcement, etc)？Aggregate stock market puzzles (equity premium, volatility, predictability)？The behavior of individual investors (disposition effect, na？ve and insufficient diversification)？Corporate finance (Security Issues and repurchases, Market timing theory, mergers and acquisitions)5.Recent Advances ？Social Interactions？Financial Crisis本课程以教师课堂讲授为主（70%），学生根据个人兴趣及能力阅读相关学术文献并做课堂报告，学生阅读相关课外书籍并作读书报告。Class participation 10%Group Presentation 20%Thesis writing 30%Final Exam 40%

中文简介: 课程将介绍金融学（特别是在金融衍生品定价及其风险管理领域）中的重要量化工具：例如，随机过程，随机微积分和偏微分方程，以及Monte Carlo模拟等模型的数值实现方法。同时，本课程避免枯燥单一的数学推导，在重视方法的同时将以生动的实例佐证量化方法在金融建模中的应用。本课程将为同学们从量化的角度理解金融学中的一些问题或从事量化研究打下基础。
英文简介: This course will discuss various mathematical tools for financial modeling, e.g., in derivatives pricing and risk management. We will cover, for example, stochastic processes, stochastic calculus, partial differential equations, and Monte Carlo simulation. We will illustrate the applications of these mathematical tools via live examples in financial modeling.

教材: 无；Stochastic calculus for finance,S. E. Shreve,Springer,2004,
教学大纲: 通过课程的讲授， 使同学们初步了解随机过程，随机微积分和偏微分方程，以及Monte Carlo模拟等多种模型的数值实现方法在金融衍生品定价和风险管理中的实践应用。本课程在介绍量化工具同时，将联系金融建模中的实例并进行生动的分析，各部分穿插进行，整体课程自成体系。数学量化工具部分主要介绍条件数学期望、随机过程，鞅、Markov过程，随机游动、Brownian运动、Poisson过程、以及Ito随机积分, Ito公式，随机分析中的一些重要工具 ，随机微分方程；偏微分方程相关内容并以金融衍生品定价为动机介绍其应用，数学方法方面我们将初步介绍偏微分方程随机微积分的联系(Feynman-Kac定理) 等，抛物型方程初值问题的求解方法。数值实现方法部分将穿插在理论工具的介绍中，主要介绍Monte Carlo模拟（随机数产生，重要分布的模拟，随机过程的模拟，提高模拟性能的方差降低方法，随机微分方程的离散模拟等），二项（或多项）格点方法，偏微分方程的数值解等。量化方法在金融建模中的应用实例大致涉及随机建模和数值方法在金融衍生品定价中的应用。如时间允许我们将从量化原理的角度探讨近期金融衍生品在我国的发展。课堂讲授平时作业占50%，期末考试占50%

中文简介: 若问：资本市场中，哪个板块成长最快？那一定是信息技术相关行业。若问：什么是可以使传统行业焕发青春活力的要素？也一定是信息技术为主导所带来的新商业模式。因此，“互联网+”已经成为我国的国家战略，各行各业正在试图利用信息技术，增加效率、扩大市场、加强服务、互联互通。可以说：信息技术从来没有像今天这样引起全社会的关注，并将深刻地改变经济运行方式、宏微观经济管理方式、生产生活方式、投融资决策方式，乃至国家安全战略等等。作为管理学院的学生，将来要投身资本市场、企业经营管理、经济管理学术研究等领域，了解信息技术最新走向，掌握信息技术基本思想方法，已经变得十分必要。然而信息技术属于比较独特的工程技术领域，不仅内容庞杂，而是思路特别，是很难通过简单浏览和勤奋自学去登堂问奥的。我们所开设的“信息技术与企业战略”，从企业发展战略的视角，以深入浅出、通俗易懂风格，全面讲解信息技术基本思想，深入介绍信息技术的最新发展，并试图回答下列问题：如何使企业获得发展先机、如何令企业焕发出更大竞争力。因此将来有志于投身资本市场、宏观经济管理、企业战略管理、企业运营与管理、新经济研究等领域的学生，这门课程将是您的正确选择。教学内容分为四个模块，大致情况如下：第一部分：基础信息技术的原理与思想在先修课“管理科学”的基础上，结合金融电子化经验，讲解：信息系统中的计算机、计算机操作系统、局域网络技术、国际互联网技术、数字签名与信息安全等信息技术基本原理与思想。第二部分：典型信息系统的介绍介绍企业运营中常见的事物处理系统、决策支持系统的概念、构架与基本原理。第三部分：信息系统的开发组织与运作思路结合大型金融企业信息化经验，介绍信息系统的开发组织构架与运作思路。第四部分：信息技术的最新发展与企业选择通过诸如：华尔街如何看待新兴信息技术，云计算与应用，物联网与应用，大数据及其在商业银行中的应用，区块链技术应用前景等论题，介绍信息技术的最新进展，以及与之相关的企业发展战略决策问题。
英文简介: If you ask: capital market, which is the fastest growing sector? The answer is of no doubt—IT related industry. If you ask: What is the key to resurrecting the traditional industry? The answer is also of no doubt—business models renewed by information technology. Therefore the "Internet +" has become China's national strategy while various industries are applying information technology to increase efficiency, expand markets, promote service or generate interoperability. In conclusion, IT has never been paid so much attention throughout the whole society as well as profoundly altered the economy growth, macro and micro economic management, the way of manufacture and lifestyle, investment and financing decision-making and even national security strategy, etc.As students of School of Management, they will take a part in the capital markets, business management, economic management and other areas of academic research. It is necessary to understand the latest development of information technology and grasp the fundamental methodology of information technology. However, information technology is a unique engineering technology, not only complicated, but also of a particular way of thinking. Hence it is difficult to achieve comprehensive understanding on the subject via common reading and self-studying, however hardworking one might be.We set up "information technology and business strategy," from the perspective of enterprise development strategy, with an understanding-friendly style, fully explains the basic idea of information technology, in-depth presentation of the latest development in information technology, so we can answer the following questions: How to gasp opportunities before other competitors? How to achieve the most competitive edge? Therefore, to all of the students，who aspire to join the capital market in the future, macroeconomic management, corporate strategic management, business operations and management, academic research in areas of the new economy related, this course will be your right choice.

中文简介: 本课程的基本内容是向学生系统讲解社会调研的基本知识，并且组织他们利用暑期赴各个社会实践基地挂职锻炼。“沃土计划”旨在让学生将实践调研知识和实地实践体验相结合，帮助其掌握学术研究的基本方法，积累社会调研的实践经验；同时，也旨在为光华管理学院的学生提供一个深入基层了解国情、社情、民情的机会，真正参与到基层群众自治组织及地方企业的管理运营中去，将课堂所学经济管理知识与地方实际相结合。学生在沃土计划的教学中收获知识的同时，更能收获不同情景下的多种体验，对其日后的发展方向具有很强的指导意义。
英文简介: The basic content of this course is to equip students with the basic knowledge of social research and practice, and provide them with the opportunity to carry out social research at social practice base during the summer vacation. "Wotu Program" is intended to help students master the basic principles and methods of academic research through combining the knowledge of social research with practice experience together. In the meanwhile, the program also aims to provide students at the Guanghua School of Management with the opportunity to understand national and social conditions at the grassroots level and to involve in community-level self-governance and the management of local businesses.

中文简介: 信息的产生与交换是金融服务业的核心。二十世纪数字化信息技术的产生和发展对金融服务业有着深刻的影响。这一影响不仅仅体现在传统金融服务效率的提升和服务成本的下降。更重要的是，在信息技术演进的驱动下产生了新的金融服务类别、服务模式，使得经济、金融系统的整体效率获得显著的提升。与此同时，金融服务中的特别需求和服务对象的行为转变也给信息技术的发展提供了方向。再过去的半个世纪中，世界各个经济体均呈现出技术和金融服务的协同发展、演进。本课程针对金融服务信息系统的演进介绍适用的理论框架。通过讲授与案例分析的结合方式帮助学生理解、掌握并应用分析金融信息技术的方法；学习、讨论技术与服务的协同演进关系。我们还将介绍在金融服务中重要的信息技术概念和应用场景。最后，在老师的带领下，学生将对金融服务技术发展前沿的实际案例做出实证分析。
英文简介: Modern information technologies have fundamentally changed the business landscape of financial services industries. Not only the efficiency of traditional financial service transactions has been significantly enhanced, new types of financial services are also emerging responding to the changing consumer demands and technology environment.  This undergraduate level course offers an introduction to the technologies that enable modern delivery of financial services. The course presents a historical view about the co-evolution of technology and the financial service industry and also discuss the frontier in technology-enabled financial innovations. Key technology concepts in financial services will be introduced and explained, setting a stage for the discussion about the implications of technology/system advances on the demand for and the provision of innovative financial services in banking, insurance, and markets for financial products. The students are expected to think critically about the bond between technology and service delivery and to gain skills in analyzing the business value, operation process, risks and control requirements of the delivery systems of financial services. Ultimately, this course aims to prepare students not only for understanding the role of IT in traditional financial service delivery, but also for creating and evaluating IT-enabled innovations in financial service delivery.Lecture materials are augmented by business case discussions. Students will be guided in analyzing business cases concerning various aspects of IT applications in financial services. With these cases, students are expected to acquire skills in critically analyzing dependence of financial services delivery on technology and understand various business considerations in the implementation and operation of financial information technologies. Skills gained in the lectures and tutorials will be reinforced by conducting a business study and forming an analysis report about an IT-enable financial service innovation in group project.

英文简介: Private and public sector firms increasingly use marketing strategies to engage their customers and stakeholders around social impact. To do so, managers need to understand how best to engage and influence customers to behave in ways that have positive social effects. This course focuses on social marketing strategies for changing the behavior of a target segment of consumers on key issues in the public interest (e.g., health behaviors, energy efficiency, poverty reduction, fundraising for social causes). In addition, it examines the growing role of social enterprises and benefit corporation (B corp) play in today’s marketplace. This class also offers students an opportunity to work on a real business problem that are tied to social initiatives.

中文简介: 本课程采用任课教授新近发展的共演战略体系框架（见《共演战略：重新定义企业生命周期》一书 ），讨论企业在UVCA的环境（未来发展方向不确定和发展路径不连续）中，如何制定和实施企业战略。共演战略理论体系框架主要包括：共演战略四要素、共演战略四阶段和共演战略四路径三个方面。从管理对象（人和事）和企业边界（内和外）两个维度考虑，共演战略包含四个构成要素：用户、组织、市场、产品。用户是企业外部的人，组织是企业内部的人，市场是企业外部的事，产品是企业内部的事。根据企业发展规律，共演战略分为四个阶段：精益创业阶段（从0到1）、精益成长阶段（从1到N）、精益扩张阶段（从N到N+）、精益转型阶段（从N+到Z）。企业在不同的战略阶段需要采用适合该发展阶段的，内在连贯的发展战略。
英文简介: As China enters a new era of development, firms are facing challenges that are different from what they experienced in the past. Uncertainty and discontinuity are two major characteristics. Entrepreneurs need to know how to deal with internal and external elements, and manage people and business related issues in the complexity unmet before. Meanwhile, as the lifecycle of firms are becoming shorter, entrepreneurs also need to know how to handle the changes in start-up, grow-up, scale-up, slow-down, and transition phases. In the course, we are going to discuss a theoretical framework which covers the major strategic elements and main phases of lifecycle of firms. We will also illustrate the theory with case studies and empirical models. The outcomes will give students a systematic and dynamic way of strategic thinking.

中文简介: 本课程主要介绍企业如何对现有产品和新产品/服务开发与管理。期间会涉及企业应如何创造性地进行产品创新与管理、新产品开发过程、消费者偏好确定、市场预测模型介绍以及新产品推广策略等。通过相关案例的分析与讨论，培养学生发现问题、分析问题和解决问题的能力。本课的目标是使学生对现有产品与新产品/服务开发与管理有一个整体了解。对那些有志于进行营销、产品/服务管理、项目管理、品牌管理与咨询的职业的学生提供基本的技能与知识储备。
英文简介: The course introduces the framework of new product development and management and discusses related issues. It covers topics such as product ideation and innovation, consumer preference and product development model, new product sales forecast and market launch strategies. The course involves extensive discussion and case analysis.

教材: 无；产品管理,唐纳德. R. 莱曼,北京大学出版社,2012,
教学大纲: 本课的目标是使学生对现有产品与新产品/服务开发与管理有一个整体了解。对那些有志于进行营销、产品/服务管理、项目管理、品牌管理与咨询的职业的学生提供基本的技能与知识储备。第一讲：新产品管理概述通过对新产品管理的意义、内容、研究方法，最新发展趋势等介绍，让学生对这门课有个总体的基本了解。第二讲：创新与新产品开发重点介绍创新的意义、创新模式以及创新与新产品开发的关系。第三讲  新产品开发的组织与风险管理重点介绍新产品开发的组织形式、团队建设与管理，以及新产品开发风险及要素，新产品开发风险的防范与补救。第四讲 新产品开发战略与过程概述新产品战略特点、作用及选择，以及新产品开发的全过程，了解各个阶段的特点、意义和作用。第五讲 市场机会确认市场机会的确认，是新产品开发的第一步，通过对市场机会的辩别，找到新产品开发的突破口。重点讲述市场机会识别与确认的方法以及对市场机会把握的关键要素。第六讲 创意产生与筛选如何使用系统化、逻辑化、可复制的思维方法挖掘需要，提供解决问题的方案是新产品开发中的重要环节。通过介绍创意思维的主要方法，开阔思路，选择最佳的解决方案。第七讲 产品开发中的模型分析 （Conjoint Analysis I）如何通过测度消费者的偏好来指导产品的设计？联合分析是营销实践中常用的可指导产品设计的模型方法。这一讲和下一讲将集中介绍联合分析模型。本讲介绍基于打分数据的联合分析模型。第八讲 产品开发中的模型分析（Conjoint Analysis II）本讲继续上一讲，介绍基于选择数据的联合分析模型，同时比较两种方法各自的优缺点。第九讲  设计思维上两讲是从量化的角度看产品设计，本讲从消费者使用的角度讨论产品设计。第十讲 新产品扩散模型本讲主要介绍新产品（耐用品）的BASS扩散模型，同时讨论其他影响产品扩散的因素。第十一讲  新产品销售预测本讲主要介绍行业中通用的新产品销售预测模型，同时通过案例展示模型的实际应用。第十二讲  新产品定位本讲主要介绍新产品定位的理论，同时通过典型案例分析颠覆性定位的意义。第十三讲：市场进入决策新产品如何进入市场才能有更大的成功机会？本讲介绍市场进入决策需要考虑的主要因素，并通过成功与失败的多个案例来分析市场进入决策的要点。第十四讲  互联网新产品本讲讨论基于互联网的新产品的特点，通过多个案例分析影响这类产品发展的因素。第十五讲、十六讲  小组报告自学与课堂讲授相结合课堂授课与外请业内人士相结合？出勤及课堂表现 10%？平时作业20%？期末闭卷40% ？学期期末报告30%

中文简介: 预测是经济学、金融学、营销学等众多管理学科的重要组成部分，也是商业实践、政府规划和战略决策过程中非常关键的一环。《商业预测分析》旨在对经济学和管理学等学科的学生提供预测方法的系统讲解和商业案例的实战训练。该课程将首先介绍预测过程中的关键要素，如决策过程、预测哲学、数据获取、模型建立和预测评价等。随之，课程将介绍预测时常用的模型和分析方法，使用这些模型时应注意的问题，以及具体在商业分析中应用。课程将着重介绍的预测模型包括线性预测模型、非线性预测模型、一元时间序列模型、多方程预测模型、模型组合和平均、高维因子模型、状态空间模型、马尔科夫转移模型、混频数据模型、不稳定性模型和波动率模型等。 涉及的案例包括对GDP、价格指数、消费者需求、存货、零售额、消费、利率、汇率、股票回报率、波动率等重要变量的预测分析。与计量经济学等相关课程不同的是，该课程强调预测方法的背景和场景应用，而不注重预测方法背后的理论性质和推导。
英文简介: Forecasting is an integrating part of economics, finance, marketing and other management disciplines, and is also the key ingredient of business practice, government planning and strategic decision making. Business Forecasting Analytics aims to provide a systematic illustration of the forecasting methods and practical training of business cases for students majored in economics and related fields. The course will first introduce the key elements in the forecasting process, such as the decision making, forecasting philosophy, data sources, model building and forecast evaluation and so on. Afterwards, the course will discuss the popular models and analysis methods used in forecasting practices, the issues related to these models and their practical applications in business analytics. The course will entertain models such as linear models, nonlinear models, univariate time series models, multiple equation models, model combination and averaging, high dimensional factor models, state space models, Markov switching models, models for mixed frequency data, models with instability, volatility models and so on. Cases studies include that the forecasting analysis of important series such as GDP, price, consumer demand, inventory, retail sales, consumption, interest rate, exchange rate, stock return, volatility etc. Unlike other courses such as Econometrics, this course focuses mainly on the background and the scenario in which the forecasting methods are applicable, but not on the theoretical properties or the derivations for these methods.

教学大纲: 本课程目标如何服务于项目的培养目标，使学生理解预测的基本哲学和逻辑，掌握商业预测的基本方法，能够应用计算机软件对常见的经济学和管理学中的数据进行建模和预测，撰写商业预测分析报告。课程提要：该课程主要包含四个部分，即预测的关键因素、预测模型、案例分析以及上机实习和小组课程项目展示。其中，前三部分为课堂讲授、展示和研讨，最后一部分为学生上机实践，锻炼动手和分析能力，并且撰写预测分析报告。具体学时分配如下：首先介绍预测过程中的关键要素，如决策过程、预测哲学、数据获取、模型建立和预测评价，以及预测报告的撰写，预计6学时；随之，课程将介绍预测时常用的模型和分析方法，使用这些模型时应注意的问题，以及具体在商业分析中应用。课程将着重介绍的预测模型包括线性回归模型的估计和预测（3学时）、非线性回归模型的估计和预测（3学时）、一元时间序列模型的估计和预测（6学时）、多方程预测模型的估计和预测（3学时）、模型组合和平均（3学时）、高维因子模型的估计和预测（3学时）、状态空间模型的估计和预测（3学时）、马尔科夫转移模型的估计和预测（3学时）、混频数据模型的估计和预测（3学时）、不稳定性模型的估计和预测（3学时）和波动率模型的估计和预测（3学时），该部分预计36学时；案例解析包括对GDP、价格指数、消费者需求、存货、零售额、消费、利率、汇率、股票回报率、波动率等重要变量的预测分析，预计6学时；课程的最后是学生上机实习，选定预测分析的项目，分组进行项目实践，并参与课程的展示和研讨。由学生展示小组项目的主要结果和分析，经课程讨论后，按照修改建议完善课程项目报告，该部分预计6学时。课程共计54学时。课堂讲授、上机实践、课程项目展示和研讨1. 小组讨论      （20%）2. 小组项目展示  （30%）3. 小组项目报告  （50%）

中文简介: 随着数据获取能力及计算能力的增强，人工智能技术已经成为主流创新技术。人工智能技术通常包括搜索算法、机器学习算法、自然语言处理、图像处理及机器人技术等。本课程将首先对主流人工智能方法进行简要介绍，对方法的优势劣势进行探讨。并重点关注人工智能背景下的企业创新情况。通过课程讲授及案例分析的方式帮助学生了解人工智能在商业创新中的实际应用。此外，本课程将邀请AI从业者作为客座嘉宾，讲授人工智能方法在业界的实际应用、相关机遇及挑战。
英文简介: With the enhancement of data acquisition ability and computing ability, artificial intelligence technology has become the mainstream innovation technology. Artificial intelligence technology usually includes search algorithm, machine learning algorithm, natural language processing, image processing and robot technology. This course will first briefly introduce the mainstream AI methods and discuss the advantages and disadvantages of the methods. And focus on the innovation of enterprises under the background of artificial intelligence. It helps students to understand the practical application of AI in business innovation through course teaching and case analysis. In addition, AI practitioners will be invited as guest guests to teach the practical application of AI methods in the industry, relevant opportunities and challenges.

教学大纲: 学生完成本课程后，应具备以下能力：（1）了解人工智能方法的历史沿革；（2）能应用课堂讲授的人工智能方法解决简单实际问题；（3）了解人工智能方法在商业创新中的具体应用；（4）形成对人工智能领域算法伦理问题形成思考；（5）根据商业需求及技术优势撰写商业计划书。课程内容包括（每一内容平均两学时左右）：（1）人工智能简介：介绍AI的概念、发展历史和当前总体应用形势（2）搜索及计划相关方法简介：介绍AI算法的核心思路方法（3）机器学习方法简介：有监督方法，介绍机器学习中的有监督学习概念，说明其特点（4）机器学习方法简介：半监督及无监督方法，介绍半监督及无监督方法，让同学们更为全面地了解及其学习（5）深度学习方法简介：介绍深度学习的常用模型，揭示其在AI发展上的重要意义，分析其结构、特征、优点和局限。（6）图像处理方法简介：介绍图像处理的一般方法，通过医疗图像识别的具体例子展现人工智能的处理效果（7）自然语言处理方法简介：介绍自然语言处理NLP的进展情况，并介绍其典型应用场景。（8）机器人传感技术简介：介绍机器人传感技术的发展现状，分析其各种应用。（9）学生课堂展示：学生通过阅读相关材料，发表自己对人工智能技术和应用的理解。（10）人工智能背景下企业创新：对人工智能行业发展进行分析，介绍AI在企业商业创新中的作用。（11）人工智能与大数据的结合：分析人工智能和大数据两者之间的关系，描述其前景。（12）人工智能应用1：电子商务：介绍AI在电子商务中的典型应用。（13）人工智能应用2：金融科技：介绍FINTECH中人工智能的作用。（14）人工智能应用3：智慧医疗：介绍医疗技术中AI的采用，可以讨论疫情中表现出来的AI典型用途。（15）人工智能算法伦理专题研讨：AI带来了一系列法律和伦理问题，例如自动驾驶中车祸责任问题，启发学生思考。（16）学生课堂展示：学生展现学生成果。课程的教学方式是以课堂讲授、计算机软件应用与案例分析相结合的方式，以讲授为主。教学过程中IT工具等技术手段的应用主要采用Python等人工智能语言。在教材方面无指定教材，以课程讲义为主。课程学生成绩评定办法包括：课堂参与：10% （根据上课考勤及课堂互动情况评定）；课程作业：20% （共两次，各占10%）；课堂展示及报告：70% （共两次，第一次30%，第二次40%）。

中文简介: 从动物到人类，从远古到现代，从幼年到老年，从感官世界到对价格的反应，它们蕴藏了怎样的行为规律？ 这些规律又如何被运用于营销中？本课程将从心理学视角，详细介绍行为科学如何帮助我们描述与理解市场行为，以及营销过程中所揭示的行为规律。我们将从行为科学的历史与研究范式开始，着重介绍心理学各个分支（认知、发展、神经科学等）与不同理论在营销策略和市场研究中的应用。另外，我们将探讨当下营销学中值得关注的问题，以及我们能否用已有的理论解释新的行为。课程内容将结合大量实证研究与现实案例，使学生理解行为科学对于营销的重要意义。
英文简介: Behavioral science is a vast discipline, originated from animal research and widely applied to human behavior. It reveals the fundamental mechanisms of our perception, attitudes, and behavior, and provides parsimonious theoretical models to explain the heterogeneous reactions to marketing. Much of the behavioral insights in marketing are rendered by principles in Psychology. Therefore, this course will introduce you to a range of psychological theories and how they support the empirical findings as well as the strategies of marketing. On top of that, we will discuss the burning questions in marketing and whether we can explain behavioral patterns that arise from technological advances with existing theories. We will cover the classics as well as the most recent findings from the marketing literature and critically evaluate them against real-life cases.

中文简介: 随着全球化、互联网和时空的普遍缩小，跨文化交流已成为人们日常生活中的必然。本课程旨在探讨跨文化沟通和文化差异的不同方面:家庭生活、社会关系、工作场所、政府、教育、性别、罗曼史和宗教。在探索这些主题的过程中，我们将努力进行个人的自我反省、实践经验，并理解与更大的社会结构之间的联系。

中文简介: 本课程包括两部分内容。第一部分强调了信息技术和信息管理在组织中的重要性。第二部分着重于组织中的数据、模型和决策第一部分，我们将关注信息技术和管理的独特特征和管理含义，以及管理者如何利用它们来改进业务流程(或创建新的业务模型)，提高客户满意度，并获得相对于竞争对手的战略优势。值得一提的是，随着中国经济的快速发展，中国的基础设施和应用技术也在快速发展。在这门课程中，我们将介绍和讨论中国在信息演进方面的表现。例子包括宏观数据和公司案例，并将与国外的案例进行比较。第二部分:(1)使学生掌握管理科学中与数据、模型、决策相关的基本原理和方法;(2)培养科学管理思维能力;(3)熟练运用计算机管理数据和求解模型的技能;(4)具有解决企业经营管理中面临的决策问题的能力。本部分将使用EXCEL作为建模工具，提高学生的EXCEL技能。
英文简介: This course covers two parts of contents. The first part highlights the importance of information technology and information management in organization. Whereas the second part emphasizes data, model and decision making in organizationFor the first part, we will focus on unique characteristics and managerial implications of information technology and management, and how managers should leverage them to improve business processes (or create new business models), enhance customer satisfaction, and gain strategic advantages over rivals. It’s worth mentioning that with the rapid development of China’s economy, China’s technology development, in both infrastructure and applications, is also keeping a rapid pace. In this course, we will introduce and discuss how China has been doing in its information evolution. Examples include macro figures and firm cases, and will be compared with foreign cases.For the second part, we will (1) enable students to master the basic principles and methods of management science related to data, model and decision; (2) cultivate the ability of thinking in scientific management; (3) and skillfully use the skills of management data and solving model of computer; (4) have the ability to solve the decision problem faced in enterprise operation and management. This part will use EXCEL as a modeling tool, which will enhance students’ EXCEL skills.
